qas.question: In which province are Serbian and Croatian both languages offial?
To what should the language be referred to instead of "Bosnian"?
In what elementary grades is Bosnian an optional course?
What languages are the official ones in Sanzak?

plausible_answers.text: in the southwest region of Sandžak

qas.question: Where is a large Serbian minority located?
What is controversial in 1st and 2nd grade of the elementary school.
What is considered moot in Novi Pazar?
What should Novi Pazar be referred to rather than "Bosnian?"

context: In Serbia, the Serbian language is the official one, while <b3_0>both Serbian and Croatian<b3_0/> are official in the province of <a0_0>Vojvodina<a0_0/>. A large Bosniak minority is present <b4_0>in the southwest region of Sandžak<b4_0/>, but the <b6_0>"official recognition" of Bosnian language<b6_0/> is moot. <b5_0>Bosnian<b5_0/> is an optional course in <a2_0>1st and 2nd<a2_0/> grade of the elementary school, while it is also in official use in the municipality of Novi Pazar. However, its nomenclature is controversial, as there is incentive that it is referred to as <a1_0><b7_0>"Bosniak"<b7_0/> (bošnjački)<a1_0/> rather than "Bosnian" (bosanski) (see Bosnian language for details).
